content.rendered:
Maple Ave Morning Announcements 

Tuesday June 10th, 2025 

Today is a “B” Day  

  • The girls’ volleyball open gym will be held after school on Mondays and Wednesdays, starting this week, from 3 to 5 in the big gym. If you are planning on staying after school, you may use the locker room between 2:15 and 2:35 and then wait in Café 2 to be taken into the gym. You will need to arrange a ride home at 5:00 p.m. Please see Coach Emanuele or Coach Conyers if you have questions. 

 Any girl interested in running cross country in the fall, there will be an informational meeting on Wednesday, June 11th in Mr. Reilly’s room, S282. No cuts, and no benches; just supportive teammates and coaches. Hope to see you there! 

 

  • Any 7th or 8th grade girls interested in trying out for the Varsity Swim Team, there will be a meeting on Thursday, June 12th during 7th and 8th grade Flex.  The meeting will be held in Mr. Muldner’s room, room 186.  Any questions, please see Coach Muldner 
  • Any girl interested in playing JV tennis in the fall should attend a brief informational meeting after school on Wednesday, June 11th. Please arrange transportation home after the meeting. If you cannot attend, see Coach Nizzi for paperwork. 

     For all girls interested in playing soccer next fall please plan to stay after school on Monday, 6/16. We will meet in gym F 2:30-2:45, you will need to find a ride home, there are no late buses. If you have any questions, please see Ms. Cocozzo or Mrs. Alexander.   

    • There will be a Field Hockey informational meeting for all 6th-8th graders interested in playing modified and JV Field Hockey on Wednesday, June 11th in the Main Gym at 2:30. There are NO late busses after school. You will need to arrange a ride; the meeting will end by 3:00.  
    • Please claim any items in the lost and found that belong to you by Friday.  

    Today’s lunch is pizza crunchers, fresh veggie cup and a chocolate chip cookie   

    Be Safe, Respectful, Be responsible and Be KIND.  

    As Always, make it a great day or not… the choice is yours.
